thread.title: LG Stylus 3 with 5.7-inch HD display, 3GB RAM and 3,200mAh battery launched for Rs 18,500
thread.title_full: LG Stylus 3 with 5.7-inch HD display, 3GB RAM and 3,200mAh battery launched for Rs 18,500

title: LG Stylus 3 with 5.7-inch HD display, 3GB RAM and 3,200mAh battery launched for Rs 18,500
text:
LG Stylus 3 with 5.7-inch HD display, 3GB RAM and 3,200mAh battery... LG Stylus 3 with 5.7-inch HD display, 3GB RAM and 3,200mAh battery launched for Rs 18,500 By March 23, 2017 “The Stylus 3 is a mid-rung offering with a 1.8mm diameter fiber-tip stylus” 
LG introduced its latest Stylus series smartphone called the Stylus 3 ( first impressions ) at this year’s CES in January. Today, the company has quietly launched the smartphone in India. The phone has been listed on the company’s website complete with price and availability details. The device comes bundled with a 1.8mm diameter fiber-tip stylus, accompanied by Pen Pop 2.0, Pen Keeper and Screen-off Memo features. 
As for the other features, the LG Stylus 3 sports a fingerprint sensor at the rear, and boots Android Nougat out of the box with LG UX 5.0. The phone comes with a large 5.7-inch HD In-Cell display, and is powered by a 1.5GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6750 processor, mated to 3GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 16GB, which can be further increased up to 2TB by inserting a microSD card. 
The LG Stylus 3’s camera department includes a 13MP autofocus rear snapper with an LED flash and an 8MP selfie shooter. The connectivity features include dual-SIM slots, 4G LTE, VoLTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1, USB OTG and GPS. A 3,200mAh battery keeps the handset alive. 
The LG Stylus 3 has been priced at Rs 18,500, and will be available via LG stores across the country.
